title: Let’s piece together the key clues
content:
1. The train is a Deutsche Bahn ICE (silver coaches with red stripe, class-2 door markings).
2. The platform numbers visible—12, 13, 14—are long-distance tracks, and the platform zones (A, B, C …) are marked by the blue-on-white letters, a system used at DB’s major terminals.
3. The train shed is entirely steel and glass, with broad glazed side-walls and multiple parallel roof bays—exactly matching the five steel-and-glass halls of Frankfurt (Main) Hauptbahnhof covering tracks 1–24, the outer two halls of which date from a 1924 extension. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frankfurt_%28Main%29_Hauptbahnhof?utm_source=chatgpt.com))

All of these point decisively to Frankfurt (Main) Hauptbahnhof. This station sits at the edge of Frankfurt’s central Bahnhofviertel district—commonly referred to simply as “the Bahnhofsviertel.”
